relation: This command was introduced. The “Uni-directional link-fault detection enabled” output field was added. The “Uni-directional link-fault detection enabled” field is not supported in this release. Therefore, the field will always display “N.”
pageTitle: Cisco IOS XR Interface and Hardware Component Command Reference for the Cisco XR 12000 Series Router, Release 4.3.x - Ethernet OAM Commands on the Cisco IOS XR Softwarethe Cisco ASR 9000 Series Router [Support] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {129100=This module provides command line interface (CLI) commands for configuring Ethernet Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (EOAM) on the Cisco XR 12000 Series RouterCisco CRS RouterCisco ASR 9000 Series Router., 3566=The measurement statistics for Y.1731 Synthetic Loss Measurement (SLM) was included.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {816131=Number of packets that have been received at this interface that have been found to be non-compliant with the packet formats specified in IEEE 802.1ag and ITU-T Y.1731., 676978=You can configure the Ethernet SLA profile to use Y.1731 DMM frames. The restriction of 150 configured Ethernet SLA operations for each CFM MEP is removed not only for profiles using DMM frames, but also for profiles using the other supported Y.1731 frame types, such as loopback measurement and synthetic loss measurement. For interoperability purposes, it is still possible to configure profiles to use DMM v0 frames. This is done by specifying a type of cfm-delay-measurement-v0 on the profile(SLA) command. The limit of 150 configured operations for each CFM MEP still applies in this case., 719085=For example, if you configure “schedule every 6 hours first at 11:15,” then the offset after midnight will be 5:15 (11:15 plus 6:00) and probes will be sent each day at 05:15, 11:15, 17:15 and 23:15., 917508=00:00:00 remaining, 437630=The default value is 1000., 735052=The statistics measurement for Y.1731 Synthetic Loss Measurement was included.}
textBeforeTable: Syntax Description error-disable-interface | log } | { disable | efd capabilities-conflict action no error-disable-interface | log } | { disable | efd capabilities-conflict action To configure what action is taken on an interface when a capabilities-conflict event occurs, use the action capabilities-conflict command in Ethernet OAM configuration mode or interface Ethernet OAM configuration mode. To return to the default, use the no form of this command. action capabilities-conflict uni-directional link-fault detection traceroute ethernet cfm traceroute cache tags synthetic loss calculation packets symbol-period window symbol-period threshold status-counter statistics measure snmp-server traps ethernet oam events snmp-server traps ethernet cfm sla operation show ethernet udld statistics show ethernet udld interfaces show ethernet sla statistics show ethernet sla operations show ethernet sla configuration-errors show ethernet oam statistics show ethernet oam interfaces show ethernet oam event-log show ethernet oam discovery show ethernet oam configuration show ethernet loopback permitted show ethernet loopback active show
textAfterTable: Command Default The default action is to create a syslog entry.
